characters: JACK, WHO IS WORRIED ABOUT HIS FRIEND
TIGHT ON TV, INSET PICTURE OF SUPERFIGHTER "PUNISHER"
JACK IN THE RING, FACING OFF AGAINST ANOTHE
JACK, WHO HANGS UP HIS END OF THE CONNECTION
ANGEL, WHO IS WORKING HIS CORNER, SHE WINCES AS
JACK, EVERY FIBER OF HIS BEING CONCENTRATED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Chinese man, GRANDFATHER, going through a beautifu Quan form. It is very peaceful and graceful. The form end palm strike towards camera, blacking out the frame. (for INTERCUT use)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotlights cut through the murky darkness while rock musi The sound of the crowd, barely visible in the darkness, i RUMBLE in the dark, not unlike the sound of an enraged an They are yelling for blood! QUICK CUTS of other fighters in the ring, including Punks wrestlers, Kickboxers, Shootfighters, and others. It's a spectacle, and we see bits and snippets of it all - the k blows, the colorful fighters, the incredible techniques, bloodshed, the brutality. DARKCLOUD and NIGHT STALKER fac the ring. (ONE FIGHT) Darkcloud is slamming Night Stalker in the head over and With the second blow, the man's mouthpiece goes flying in crowd. Soon, the blood starts to spray, but the man doesn hitting. In the front row, right next to the ring, is JACK CODY, a old dreamer. Drinking it all in, he is yelling his lungs the fighters. A WOMAN standing next to Jack cringes at the brutality an her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: How can you watch this?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's great, isn't it? I love it! The woman looks at Jack uncomprehendingly, then shakes he and steps over him to get out, then walks up the stairs t exit. Though the woman is very beautiful, Jack doesn't even wat go. He is too intent on the action in the ring. Now, one of the women fighters, ANGEL, dressed in a sexy that shows off her body, but also displays her finely def muscles, is fighting another SuperFighter. She is brutali other fighter, yet both are covered in blood. The towel has now been thrown in, but Angel STILL doesn' Angel has her opponent by the throat and is motioning to crowd, thumbs up or thumbs down. "NO MERCY" cries the crowd, and Jack is yelling louder th anyone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Take it to her, Angel! Yeah! Angel spins and hook kicks her opponent in the head, then the other way and side kicks her into the ropes. The othe FLIES off the ropes and lands face down in the center of It's brutal and barbaric. And Jack loves every minute of it. A spotlight lights up the stage, and two bizarre FIGHTERS the middle, facing each other.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: In the red corner, Budokai! BUDOKAI is dressed in a gold lame uniform, his belt black face is painted like a kabuki actor, a mixture of black a and gold, and his outfit emphasizes his massive muscles.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And in the blue corner, the Enforcer! THE ENFORCER, dressed like a street punk, with chains and spikes and chrome, comes into the ring. He is the bad guy and everyone knows it. He raises his muscled arms over hi and smiles at the crowd, then brings them down into a fig stance.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: SuperFight! The two fighters face off in fighting positions. The rock increases its BEAT, and the fighters rush each other, the echoing with the fury of their techniques. Budokai is a m artist, while the Enforcer is a thug. But a well trained nonetheless. Using a mixture of professional wrestling, boxing and str fighting, the Enforcer HAMMERS Budokai in a beautifully choreographed fight. Budokai beaten, the Enforcer stands before the crowd, see asking them for a decision. The crowd ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: What'll it be? Mercy? The crowd YELLS out "NO MERCY!" Everyone except Jack that likes Budokai, after all. The Enforcer listens to what they want, then smiles and huge roundhouse right. Budokai goes sailing out of the ri Jack sees this and runs to where Budokai is going to land thinking to break his fall. He does, sort of, but Budokai still lands HARD. They stan together, both a little stunned. The Enforcer is now out ring and coming towards Budokai, and Jack is caught in th Jack, in the heat of the moment, turns to face off with t Enforcer! He throws a couple of kicks and punches, which effect - except to further enrage the Enforcer. The Enforcer goes crazy and attacks Jack. Budokai grabs J throws him up into the sky, and then knocks the Enforcer Jack lands on top of the Enforcer (like a pin in wrestlin counting him out. The ref comes out of the ring and holds up Budokai's hand Budokai reaches down and pulls Jack up to a standing posi holding his hand up.

dialogues.speaker: NO MERCY
dialogues.text: Budokai looks at Jack, who is beaming with pride, as the goes crazy. Budokai winks at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: BUDOKAIL
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. Couldn't have done it without you... Jack is in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loading dock is closed up, shut down tight. The streets it are almost empty. A JOGGER runs by in front, getting a in before a busy day starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the loading dock, we MOVE THROUGH the assembled goods, and various things. In the b.g. can be heard the sound of breathing, and solid THUNKS and THWOCKS . We MOVE through a door that is ajar, into an area of the separate from the storage area. On the walls are posters "SuperFights", martial arts training posters, pictures of Lee, Chuck Norris, Jean Claude Van Damme (from "No Retrea Surrender"), movie posters, professional wrestlers, etc. Pictures of a fighter named MIKE ROCCO are featured promi Rocco, in the pictures, is wearing a special necklace (Op Hand?). There is a magazine with his picture on it, and t reads "Rocco: Where is he now?" There is also a picture o with his arm around a young fighter - a younger Jack. We see a SHADOW of what looks like two people fighting o picture of Rocco. The sounds of violent training are closer, more immediate A counter is piled high with training books, and a TV/VCR combination sits next to them, a pile of martial arts tra videos sitting on top. A tape is in the machine, and it i on one particular instructor, Mike Rocco, demonstrating a technique. Standing next to the counter are mannequins in various po all dressed in sporting goods equipment - at first they l real fighters. We see Jack moving among them, doing flips the aid of an unseen trampoline). Some of the mannequins are wearing protective equipment, swimsuits, still others in martial arts uniforms. Smoothly, we TURN AROUND to see Jack, in a muscle shirt a workout pants, working on a mannequin, and we realize tha are just mannequins, not real people. He is very athletic obviously been training for some time. He is not a master is strong and effective, with a great deal of raw talent. When he hits and kicks the heavy bag, in the middle of the room, it SHAKES the entire room. Jack is wearing the special necklace that Rocco had on in pictures. After one particularly grueling combination, Jack stops, from a sport bottle nearby. He then grabs the TV remote a a button.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: The tape continues, the instructor (Mike Rocco) moving on another combination. Jack watches it carefully, then rewinds it, and plays it then presses "pause" and puts the remote back. He starts the heavy bag again, mimicking the combination the instru showed on the tape. As he is working this combination, an alarm on his watch and Jack stops. He gathers himself for a moment, then bow mannequin.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Time for the SuperFight. He moves to the area of the room where the mannequins are He moves into the middle of them, then raises his arms li Budokai did last night. He goes into action, throwing kicks and punches at the ma breaking them into pieces, throwing them into all the cor the room. When he is done, he stands panting in the center of the raises his arms again. One mannequin is still standing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No mercy. He jumps off the trampoline (we see it now) and drives a wheel kick at the lone mannequin and hits it, but sends h sprawling at the same time. The fantasy is disrupted by reality. Jack smiles and puts in his hands, resting.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Cody? That you? Jack doesn't answer right away.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, Jean Claude Van Dunce? You there?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, Frankie. Just finishing up! FRANKIE comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Man, are you wasting your time with this stuff again? Hey, don't leave a mess again, OK? Hurry up, we gotta get these orders out!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) OK! I'll be right down. Jack gets off the ground and starts to clean up the piece mannequin around the room. He assembles the mannequins ag his next workout, then pauses at the "SuperFights" and "M Rocco" posters.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Someday... The CAMERA PULLS OUT, past the tapes, books and posters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of a run down tract house in a "poor wh trash" suburb of the city. The house is much cleaner than others in the area. Obviously, some care has been taken w house. Jack's battered Jeep pulls up to the house, and he gets o pauses for a moment in the front yard, then shakes his he up some trash from the neighbor's yard, and moves inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks into the house, weary from a long day of work, hangs up his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm home!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: What? No UltraFights tonight?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (smiling wearily) It's SuperFights, and they were last night.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: What time did you get home?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I got to work on time, nobody got hurt, what difference does it make, Mom? Jack's MOTHER comes around the corner and confronts Jack. a road they've been over many times, but that won't stop Mother from trying to make a point.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: What about you? I think it's hurting you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm not in the ring... yet. When I'm one of the fighters, then you can worry. OK?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: You won't be one of them, Jack, not while I'm around.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: When they have another try out, I'm going to be first in line.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: No you won't. Your father wouldn't have wanted...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let's not do this again, Mom. I gotta go...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I have dinner ready for you, just like you like it. Where are you going, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Out, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Jack, don't walk away from me! I'm talking to you! Jack doesn't stop walking as he grabs his jacket, and th out the door. He can be seen walking to his Jeep through ripped and patched screen door.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: You come right back here, John Jacob Cody! This minute! Jack is gone, and his Mother stands there for a moment, w The Jeep STARTS UP, 0.S., and we see the headlights FLARE Jack's Mother's face.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (to herself) Over my dead body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted parking lot of a city bank. A young, very attr Chinese woman, SALLY WONG, walks to the Cash machine outs bank, on her way home from work. She looks around to make sure no one else is there, then to the machine. She puts in her card, presses several but completes her transaction. Her cash is counted out into a drawer, and she reaches in and pulls it out. Just as she turns to go, a voice behind her calls out men

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: We'll take that, sister. Sally whirls around to see three GANG MEMBERS moving towa They have taken away her escape route. She makes a fist w hand, as if she is trying to decide whether it's worth a Just then a Jeep pulls into the parking lot of the bank, cut through to another street. It's Jack's Jeep, and he p a moment, taking in the scene. The LEADER turns to look a

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Keep moving, asshole. Jack looks for a moment longer, then pulls out. Sally starts to raise her hands to fight, and the Leader what she is doing and pulls out a wicked looking knife to her.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: It's not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Remember, it's only money, and you didn't have it long enough to get attached to it. Sally looks at the knife, then up at the Leader. She tak glance around, noting the surveillance camera up in one c the building.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: No time, sugar. We'll be long gone, and you'll be all cut up. (beat) Now. The Jeep pulls into the parking lot again, and this time right in the middle of the lot, its lights pointed straig group. The High Beams of the Jeep flick on, momentarily b everyone, and the horn BLOWS. The Leader, one hand over his eyes, motions to one of his get rid of whoever it is.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Take care of that guy! The Gang Member goes up to the Jeep, and is surprised to EMPTY. Running, lights on, but empty.

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER
dialogues.text: Ain't nobody here! The Leader, who was moving in on Sally, turns to the Gang

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: What? Just then, from behind one of the bank pillars, STORMS Ja taking the Leader and the other gang members completely b surprise. Using a variety of kicks, punches, strikes and moves, he takes them out with little resistance. He wades them like they were the mannequins he trains on at work.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah! This is just what I needed! When he's done, Jack turns to Sally and smiles, then moti her to join him. Sally gets in Jack's Jeep, and he pulls quickly out of th The gang members are still on the ground, some of them st moan and move around a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is driving along, and Sally is sitting very primly i Jeep. Jack steals looks at her, and she looks at him side Jack is intrigued by this beautiful Chinese girl.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Turn right here. This is my house. The Jeep comes to a stop. Sally opens the door and start out..

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Want to come in? (very softly) I'd like you to meet my grandfather. Jack turns the engine off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Meet your grandfather? Sounds like real fun... They get out of the Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally leads him into her house.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: He's kind of an old codger... just take him with a grain of salt.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I love old codgers. Through the window, we see a SHADOW looking at them. Then disappears. They go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meat cleaver THWACKS down into a wooden cutting board a straight up. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Sally's Grandfather, who was cooking when they came in. He is at least 75 years old, and is we dark blue Chinese silk jacket.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You fought them over money?!? Are you a COMPLETE moron? Jack looks at Sally for help.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You could have gotten her killed.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: They might not have stopped at the money, Grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You don't KNOW that. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, correct me if I'm wrong, but most relatives...

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You are wrong. Don't speak unless spoken to.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Grandfather! The Grandfather looks at Sally, sighs, and then examines closely.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You are a fighter? What style?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: All different styles.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Which style? Do not attempt to con me.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I use what works, from karate, kung fu, kickboxing, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, it worked tonight.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Let me see your hands, 'fighter'. Jack holds out his hands and Grandfather holds them, look them and squeezing them. Jack squeezes back, but it has n on Grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You have never trained.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can handle myself.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Grandfather, what are you doing? I invited Jack in to thank him.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Maybe he set the attack up himself, so he would look good.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I've had about enough... Jack tries to pull his hands away, but he cannot. Jack co to try to pull away, but Grandfather has his hands in a v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Grandfather takes Jack's hands and forces them into the f the counter top.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: OK, fighter, let's see how good you really are. All you have to do is touch me and I will give you the credit you think you deserve. OK?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. Does he do this to every guy you bring home?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I... Grandfather?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Only the ones claiming to be heroes. C'mon, just one touch... Jack, thinking he is going to catch Grandfather unaware, for him, but he's no longer there. Jack moves again, tryi touch him, but Grandfather is a ghost. No matter how he t with what techniques, he can't lay a finger on him. Finally, Jack is so frustrated he gives up. He grabs a to starts to wipe the flour off his hands.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I gotta get outta here. Sally, I'll call you. He walks past Grandfather, who is smiling in success. Bef completely passes him, however, Jack tries one more time him. Grandfather, with eyes in the back of his head, move out of the way, and all Jack touches is air.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Jack, don't go! Jack is already at the door and opening it. He tosses the back into the room. Sally runs after him, giving Grandfat very dirty look. He just smiles an innocent smile that sa protecting you, my dear."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally pushes open the door of her house, but Jack is alre his Jeep and driving away. She watches him drive away, then raises her face to the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just once why can't he mind his own business and stay out of my life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's Jeep, driving on a deserted highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, still a little angry, driving and thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack drives up to his house, and is surprised to see his lit up, with tons of people milling around. There are Rep Camera Crews, Neighbors and more. Jack pulls his Jeep into the driveway, and gets out. The group explodes in applause, but Jack still can't figure o is going on. He spots a policeman and yells

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is my Mom OK? He nods and motions that she is inside the house. Jack heads for the house, but is stopped by a TV REPORTER camera crew.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: How does it feel to be a hero?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What hero? What are you talking about? Jack pushes his way through the crowd and towards his hou concerned about his mother. In the b.g. we hear the TV Reporter finishing her report.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: Modest and unassuming, untouched by stardom, Jack Cody might be a hero in the truest sense of the world. Just someone who, despite the odds, does the right thing. This is Carol Hartman, Channel 8, live at the Cody house. Back to you, Bob. Jack gets to his front door and throws it open.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mom, are you all right? He goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks into the living room, and sees his Mom getting u front of the Tv.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mom! Are you OK? What's with all the people outside? Jack's Mother runs to Jack, hugging him.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Jack, I'm so proud of you! You're a hero!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Watch! I taped it for you! She pushes the "play" button the VCR and a news report un

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Punisher found dead - a violent end for a violent fighter. (beat) And now for some good news: Take a look at some extraordinary footage from Fulton Bank... The screen shifts to grainy color security video, which r the rescue scene where Jack came to the aid of Sally. Jac the three guys, and then hustles Sally into his Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: We traced the license plate of the Jeep to Jack Cody, an employee of GoodSports, a sporting goods distributor... Jack turns off the VCR and turns to his mother.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: They've been waiting hours for you, Jack. You saved that girl! You should go out and talk to them, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don't really want to, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: This is your chance, Jack. You're break.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Don't make that much out of it, Mom. I just did what had to be done. Mother leads Jack to the front door and opens it. Immedi crowd on the lawn surges forward to the door.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: This is good news, Jack. There isn't enough good news on the TV. You know what I mean? Jack nods and opens the front door. The questions start coming, and the lights of the cameras flash of cameras WHITE OUT the picture as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON TV IMAGE OF JACK, blinded by the lights of the T cameras. He is bombarded with questions, attention which with his characteristic good humor. ANGLE ON ROBERT SAWYER, PROMOTER OF SUPERFIGHTS. He is watching the TV with interest, the lights from the illuminating his face. He presses the "Mute" button on the remote, and the scene on the TV without any sound.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: He's perfect. Robert goes behind his desk and pushes the intercom on hi

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Lonnie, get me... The name "Jack Cody" flashes onto the screen, underneath image talking to reporters.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Jack Cody. He's on Channel 8 right now. Set up a meeting for tomorrow, here.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Oh, and Lonnie? Make sure he comes alone. No agents, no lawyers. Thanks. He hangs up the phone and then presses "Mute" again. It's Jack talking on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I just did what I had to do. Anybody else would have done the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An All American Hero. Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is out for his training run, and he is spotted by pe walking and working on the street. He runs by a crew of W working on the construction of a house.

dialogues.speaker: WORKMEN
dialogues.text: Way to go, Jack! He heads downtown on his run, and a schoolbus goes by and of SCHOOLCHILDREN spot him. KIDS. It's him, it's the hero. Hey, Jack! Can we have your autograph? Jack waves back, feeling really good. He turns down a city street, and two beautiful WOMEN RUNN coming towards him. One of the RUNNERS nudges the other a to Jack. She smiles at him as he runs past.

dialogues.speaker: RUNNER
dialogues.text: Want to run my way, Jack? Jack continues running, but his pace definitely slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is rushing around, trying to get ready for his meeti Robert. His mother is following him, haranguing him for e considering becoming a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I don't want you to go to this meeting, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You're the one who wanted me to talk to the reporters, and Mr. Sawyer called me because he saw me on TV.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: You want to be a professional wrestler your whole life?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, but being a SuperFighter is a lot different from being a pro wrestler, and a couple of years doing it would be fun. I had my 15 minutes of fame, Mom. Now is the time to capitalize on it.  He starts to tie his neck tie, and is having trouble.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mom, can you help me out here? I could die trying to tie this thing.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (after a beat) No. I won't help you with this. She walks out of his room, leaving Jack to fend for himse He stares at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Great, just great. I hope he's more interested in my fighting than my wardrobe. He does a sloppy job tying his tie, then grabs a notebook heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mom?!? I'm going. Wish me luck? No answer.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot! He goes out the door, and only when he is completely gone mother come into the room, a worried look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert's office building, with the legend "SuperFights" o front door. Jack walks up to the front of the building, a the sign, then walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens and Jack walks up to a very impre solid wood door, with "SuperFights" engraved into it. He of the huge brass doorknobs and pulls the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks up to the RECEPTIONIST, who is seated at a sta art computer workstation. Her face lights up when she see

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Jack Cody, right?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Let me just say I'm a big fan. I think it's great that you're going to be working with us! Jack doesn't know what to say. Working with the SuperFig

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Mr. Sawyer is expecting you, Mr. Cody. He's just finishing up a meeting. As she says this, the door to Robert's office opens, and three SUPERFIGHTERS: Darkcloud, Night Stalker and Budokai aren't dressed like SuperFighters, however. They are dres in black: leathers, sweatshirts, parachute pants, etc. Behind them walks Robert, and together they notice Jack, tried to move out of the way (and to close his open mouth watches his heroes come towards him).

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Jack! Robert Sawyer! Let me introduce you to some friends of mine.

dialogues.speaker: BUDOKAL
dialogues.text: Hey, I remember you! Man, welcome to the team! You're my hero now, Jack! Jack can't believe he is actually talking to the SuperFig

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: I'm Darkcloud, but call me Chuck, OK? Can I call you Jack?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Uh... Sure.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT STALKER
dialogues.text: I'm Cliff, better known as Night Stalker. It's an honor to shake your hand, Mr. Cody.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Honor? C'mon, you guys are...

dialogues.speaker: BUDOKAL
dialogues.text: You're gonna love it here!

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: You sure are. Just make sure you ask for enough money from Robert here.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: He can squeeze pennies so hard they bleed, man.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: That's enough, gentlemen. Jack and I have some matters to discuss. Where's your lawyer, Jack? Sharpening his pencil?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it, c'mon in! You guys be careful out there tonight, you hear?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERFIGHTERS
dialogues.text: (together) Yes, Sir! See ya around, Jack! Robert leads Jack into his office, and then closes the do him, smiling at the SuperFighters.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Have a seat, Jack. Can I get you something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, thanks, Mr. Sawyer. Thanks for inviting me over. It was great to meet those guys.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Those guys are friends of yours, Jack. And, thank you for coming here tonight. I know you have a lot of demands on your time now. You're a popular man. (beat) I want to get right to the point, Jack. I want you to be a SuperFighter. Is that something that you'd like?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I'd kill to be one of the SuperFighters!

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I'm not asking for that... yet. (smile) All I want to do is make you an offer.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The answer's yes.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I haven't made the offer yet, Jack. Do you have an agent?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No. Should I?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. Most of the fighters don't, in fact. I'll walk you through the contract, and I think we'll come to a fair agreement, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You bet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we do that, however, I want to introduce you to my favorite SuperFighter, Angel. A side door to the office opens up, and Angel, the female SuperFighter from the opening scene, walks in. She is dre her very revealing, very sexy outfit, and she comes over

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I saw you on the news. I can't believe I'm actually meeting you! Jack is almost speechless.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I saw you fight the other night...

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I wish I had seen you...

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: If we can come to terms, Jack, I'd like Angel to train you. (beat) If that's OK.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (swallowing hard) Yeah, that'd be great.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I'm a real slave driver, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You have to listen to me about... everything. I think you've got great potential, and with a little hard training, you can be a great SuperFighter!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Angel, can you excuse us for a little while? Jack and I have to cross the t's and dot the i's.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Don't take too long, OK? I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: We'll all go out to dinner after, OK, Jack? Jack nods, watching Angel leave the room. Robert pulls out a thick contract and puts it down on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the contract. I advise you to read it carefully, but it's tough going. I'll go over the main points with you. OK? Angel is now at the door, and she stops and catches Jack' then winks.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I want to warn you, Robert, I'm a pretty tough negotiator. I'm no pushover. Robert smiles and sits down, ready to put the hammer to J

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I saw that the minute we met, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of the exterior of the warehouse. Two b stand outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "Death Match" is going on, with THE BEAST against a Cit crowd is wild and unruly, and betting is going on through scene. The Beast beats the Citizen handily, and then KILLS him b It's quite a difference from the SuperFights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STREET GANG made up of punks and toughs, along with the occasional girlfriend, is hanging out in an alley, smokin cigarettes and killing time. (6 to 8 GANG MEMBERS - Black Hispanic, White) Suddenly, one of the street gang's LOOKOUTS is propelled alley. He SLAMS into the wall on the other side and colla heap, MOANS once, then is silent. The gang is up and on their feet, ready for action.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: What the hell...? The SUPERFIGHTERS (Budokai, Night Stalker, Darkcloud) com three doorways into the alley, immediately surrounding th gang. The Leader starts to go for his weapon, but a movem Darkcloud stops him.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that, Bubba.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: Name's not Bubba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is if I say it is, Bubba. One of the gang members moves towards Darkcloud, and he i immediately taken out, brutally, hit and kicked and SLAMM the wall. INSERT shot of THUGS raising guns, preparing for action.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: What do you want, man?

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: 30% of the action.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: What the hell for?

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: So that doesn't happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: No thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: You got a nice operation, Bubba.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: Drugs, grand theft auto, extortion - we want in.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: And if I say no?

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: You know you can't say no, Bubba. Oh, by the way, it's up to 40% now. Want to try for 50% by complaining some more?

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: Screw you, man.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: Wrong answer, Bubba. The SuperFighters JUMP into action in the alley. They are trained fighters, and the gang members are no match for t over quickly, with brutal efficiency, the SuperFighters d the gang members. When it's over, Darkcloud stands the Leader of the gang u applying a very painful joint lock.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: 50-50 now, Bubba. Pick ups once a week. Try to cheat me, you get dead. Comprende? The Leader nods, in a world of pain. About eight miscellaneous TOUGHS, who are aiming guns, c from the darkness. Darkcloud turns towards them and smile motioning to the Gang Members on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: See, I told you we wouldn't need you guys. They said we couldn't beat some sense into your thick skull! He laughs and drops the Leader, motioning for his SuperFi follow him out of the alley. The gang members stay on the too hurt to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks through the door into the training gym, which high tech, all marble, machines and red and blue floors. best for the SuperFighters. Jack is astonished by the roo walks around looking at it in awe. As he looks around, in walks Angel.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Good morning, Jack. It's nice to see you're on time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm all yours.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: How true. You got a clean bill of health from our doctors. Let's see what you can do, OK? She pushes a button on a keyboard located on a pedestal, Tvs in the marble wall are revealed.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: This is the main training area for the fighters. Usually, you all train together, but we'll be training alone for the first couple of weeks, however.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why? They walk over to the two beams of light streaming down a one wall.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Jack, don't ask too many questions, OK? When I call out a kick or a punch, you hit through the lights. They measure speed and power. Got that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping side. Jack does it. A power read out registers on the computer

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Backfist, straight punch. Jack does it.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Spinning hook, roundhouse, front kick. Jack performs them, hitting the beams of light each time.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Left hook. Right jab. Left uppercut. Jack does them all, and is performing very well. A series CUTS shows Jack hitting the bags and targets, with each h scoring "power points" on the computer read out.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Now I want to measure your reaction time. Enter the chamber, please. She walks over to the keyboard and punches in several com Jack stands in the middle of the chamber, and suddenly th on each side of the chamber come flying out. Jack tries t the poles, but still gets hit a few times while doing it. We see the computer screen measuring the result of the tr

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: OK! Take a break for a minute, Jack. (beat) Not bad. Your numbers are pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thanks. Is the test done?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Not quite yet, Jack. Angel moves up close to Jack, body to body.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What... are you doing, Angel?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Checking vital signs... She presses her finger against the vein in his neck, feel pulse.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Not too fast, that's good. She runs her hands over his body, gently, caressing. She the vein in his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: A little faster now - you enjoying yourself, Jack? That's good, too... Her hands goes farther down, caressing his buttocks, then towards the front.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Angel...? Jack jumps a little, and Angel snaps.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Stand still! She presses her right hand between his thighs.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Best indicator of heart rate activity. Your heart's pumping to beat the band, Jack... She smiles at Jack, then pulls her hand back, taking care up against the front of his workout pants as she goes. An growls a little.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: My favorite vital sign... Oh, the things you'll see, Jack. We're going to have so much fun training together.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (forced, throaty, embarrassed) Should we be doing this?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You'll do whatever I say.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Here? Now? Angel laughs, then starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: We have all the time in the world, Jack. We start for real, training, I mean, tomorrow. Get a good night's sleep, Jack, you'll need it. She tosses him a bottle of pills. He catches it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Vitamins. Special for the SuperFighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like pills.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: They're vitamins, Jack. Take them. Jack watches as Angel exits, leaving Jack tortured and al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert is in his office, kissing with Lonnie, his recepti when the door flies open and OATES comes in flanked by tw BODYGUARDS. They have knives drawn, and they PULL Robert and Lonnie a Oates holding Lonnie, the Bodyguards holding Robert, kniv both their throats. Robert looks at him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Mr. Oates. What a pleasant surprise. Oates moves the knife closer to Lonnie's throat, and she pull away, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: OATES
dialogues.text: If I was calling the shots, you'd be already dead. Understand me, Sawyer? Robert just nods.

dialogues.speaker: OATES
dialogues.text: Instead, my people want to send you a message. You don't agree, we kill the girl.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: The girl? Oates indicates Lonnie.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Oh, her. (beat) Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: OATES
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Go ahead. You got what it takes?

dialogues.speaker: OATES
dialogues.text: I kill her, you're next.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: You have to do her first. Lonnie looks at Robert, stunned at what he is saying. Th would sacrifice her. Robert is still smiling, until he moves, and when he move incredibly quick, and brutal. He strikes the two bodyguar they go down immediately. When they are down, he turns to Oates, who still has the Lonnie's throat.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Your turn. I'm calling your bluff. Oates doesn't move, but he is terrified by this unfeeling Robert moves and HITS Oates, knocking him away from Lonni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert doesn't even see that Lonnie has been hurt. He clo Oates.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight... You thought you'd tell me what to do? Strongarm me? Is that how your pea brain works?

dialogues.speaker: OATES
dialogues.text: What's the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I'm the big deal.

dialogues.speaker: OATES
dialogues.text: Hey, I won't do it again, if that's what you want.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: That's only part of what I want. Robert attacks Oates, and he is brutal and ruthless. He hits him with a strike to the stomach, which doubles h

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: That hurt? Straighten up. With difficulty, Oates straightens up and tries to hit Ro soon as he comes all the way back up, Robert blocks his s hits him again, with a different technique this time. Oat farther down, and seems to hurt much more.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: That hurt more, I could tell. Interesting...

dialogues.speaker: OATES
dialogues.text: (between gasps) C'mon, I said I'd stop. He grabs Oates by the hair and stands him up. Oates trie on Robert, but he blocks it easily and drives a strike in arm, breaking it.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I never knew that was so effective. Oates' arm hangs limply by his side, and his face is a ma agony. Robert hits him a couple more times, analyzing the reaction.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Hmmm... Lonnie, you should leave now. Robert drives a knife hand into Oates' collar bone, break with an audible CRACK. Oates' screams again, and now both arms hang useless at his sides.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: How bad is the pain? Can you describe it? No answer from Oates, who is in incredible pain. He pulls back and gets himself set, then drives forward w special technique, striking Oates in the chest, right whe heart is. Oates' eyes go wide, and his mouth opens in a silent scre he drops over dead. Robert stands over Oates and studies his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: It works. And, you'll never threaten me again. It's just a win-win day. He exits the room without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exclusive, gated community - expensive townhouses and guards. A limousine pulls up and into a parking place, an step Angel and Jack. She leads him into one of the units.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an incredible apartment, complete with vaulted ceili fireplace, open staircase, eat in kitchen, exercise room more. Angel gives him a guided tour, and we tag along. In the master bedroom, Angel lays on the bed and motions to join her. Jack shakes his head and moves on to another

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS of Jack eating dinner at an expensive resta with other SuperFighters (Budokai, Night Stalker, DarkClo etc.), Angel, beautiful women, etc. At the end of the obv expensive meal, Jack pulls out his wallet and, over prote from the rest of the group, produces a wad of bills to pa tab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack comes out of his apartment carrying his workout bag, his workout with Angel. He runs up to his Jeep, only this it's not his beat up Jeep, but a beautiful, new Jeep Cher Sport. He hops in and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is training with Angel. Before they begin, she hands cup of water, and he takes the pill. They start training, and Angel is a slave driver. Jack ha worked so hard.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: This is our newest training device, designed by SuperFights for close quarter combat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack drives past the warehouse where he used to work, and irony is lost on him. Frankie is outside, and he spots Ja

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Jack! Way to go, man! Hey, can you stop for a second? Yo, Jack! Jack smiles and drives on. Jack passes by an area of the city in his new car, and Sa her way to work, a working girl with a briefcase. She sto light, next to a workman carrying a mirror. We see Jack's first in the mirror, then Sally sees him. She tries to sa but he doesn't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is running stairs, with Angel watching, holding a st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Angel are standing in the river, throwing kicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angel is drilling Jack with Muay Thai bags. Jack is kicki sweating up a storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Angel are running together. They start to sprint Angel is staying right with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is heading for the door for a workout. He stops at t and takes his "vitamin".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is lifting weights, with Angel as his coach. He is w very hard, and Angel is urging him to work even harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is lying in the whirlpool, the bubbles flying around steam rising, taking the pain out of his tired muscles. The door to the locker room opens and Jack barely acknowl he is so exhausted. We get the impression of a HUGE, HULKING BEAST who appear steam behind Jack, who is totally unaware. The Beast comes closer, big hands and arms reaching for J a muffled order is BARKED. Jack sits up straight in the whirlpool, looking around fo someone, something.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Who's there? No one answers. The Beast recedes into the anonymity of the steam, leavin searching in the steam for the something he thought he sa

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is a rookie thing, right, guys? Ha, good one! You guys got me a good one! He sits back down in the whirlpool, but doesn't quite rel way he was before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, after his whirlpool, comes out of the locker room. He goes past the Women's locker room, and there is Angel, view, almost completely naked. Jack doesn't want to look, stops anyway. Angel knows that Jack is watching, and she consciously gi little show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON RING, where a SuperFights bout is going on. Two flamboyant fighters are going at each other, in a series techniques. It's RASPUTIN against THE MERCENARY. Rasputin dressed like a Red Army General crossed with a mad monk. Mercenary is dressed like an American soldier in this "pa battle. Angel and Jack are sitting with Robert in the crowd. Jack is in street clothes, watching the action (his first not for a little while). The crowd is loud and ready for violence, and the SuperFights are ready to give it to the INSERT: Underground betting is going on here.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: You ready for this craziness?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (looking at Angel) You bet. Just say the word.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: It's Angel's call.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Soon. The fight continues, and The Mercenary is really taking t to him, but the things that The Mercenary is doing aren't any effect on Rasputin. In fact, Rasputin looks really angry. The Mercenary hits a roundhouse right, and there is NO reaction. Nothing. The Mercenary stops fighting and stares at Rasputin, unbe

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCENARY
dialogues.text: C'mon, man. Let's do it. At that moment, Rasputin attacks, and tears into The Merc The Mercenary is not ready for the onslaught, and he is g really hurt. The crowd is going wild, and everyone is on their feet.  Robert is concerned. He looks at Angel.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: What's going on? Angel shrugs, and looks back at the ring.

dialogues.speaker: FIND OUT
dialogues.text: Angel nods and rushes off. Robert forces a smile to Jack, concentrates on the fight again.

dialogues.speaker: RING
dialogues.text: The Mercenary is a bloody mess, and Rasputin is raging at and everything. Darkcloud is yelling at Rasputin to let T Mercenary go.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: C'mon, man, he's hurt. Let me come get him...

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: He's mine! The other SuperFighters, including Night Stalker and Dark are debating whether to go inside to get Rasputin. They a to go in, when one of the Doctors shows up with a tranqui gun. He takes aim at Rasputin, who is still putting a hurt on Mercenary. He slaps his neck where the tranquilizer goes SCREAMS at the assemblage, then falls into a heap on the The Mercenary falls unconscious next to him. Jack is still watching from the stands. In the Ring both fighters are being carted out by paramed

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: What a fight! Don't want to meet the Mad Russian in some dark alley later, I'll tell you that... Next up, Darkcloud takes on the Dynamic Duo. It's two against one! <BEAT> I've just been informed that we have our newest SuperFighter in the crowd - Jack Cody, A spotlight illuminates Jack, and he puts his hand up to through the glare. The crowd erupts in applause when Jack up. It's his moment in the sun, and the bright light wipes ou image of the fight before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Angel are working out. They are trading kicks, w up. Angel is an incredible martial artist. Both of them a wearing protective gear, which is very futuristic and hig They start to speed up, and Jack begins to wonder if he c her. He tries to score some points on her, and catches he guard. He scores a kick to the body, and smiles a little. Angel stops and looks at him, hands on her hips.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (smiling) You want to go?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (beat) Sure. You?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You think you're ready?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ready as ever.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: OK. Go for it. They bow to each other and then touch fists. Jack gets in fighting stance, and starts to throw a combination, but b can even move, Angel is all over him. She is throwing all techniques, feet and hands, and she is scoring at will. H movements are like lightning, and Jack is getting an old ass whupping. Angel spots Robert off to the side, watching. Angel, in o make Jack look good, starts to lose. They go at it, and Jack is very impressive. Angel leaves open for an attack, and Jack responds with a flying spin hitting her. Robert comes out of the background now, applauding a litt

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Is he ready?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Yes. Robert exits the room, and he and Angel slap hands, excit then pulls him into an embrace, one that starts as a cele and quickly moves to something else. Jack catches himself and pulls away from her.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You better get some rest, Jack. We can, you know, finish this later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (beat) Hey, I read where the police found Rasputin's body. What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Random killing, I guess. It's a violent world, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How'd he get so out of control?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I told you about asking questions, Jack. "Sides, the SuperFights await.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What's it like?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Nothing you've ever seen before... She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally comes walking up to her house, a piece of paper in It is a playbill advertising the next SuperFights. Jack, as the "All American Hero," is featured prominently ad, which is selling tickets and the pay-per-view coverag looks at the playbill for a long time, remembering Jack a way her Grandfather treated him. Just then, the door to their house opens, and Grandfather expert in ancient Chinese healing arts, is showing an inj PATIENT out of the house. Sally sees her grandfather and quickly folds the playbill smallest possible size, then hides it in her purse. She t into her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "SuperFights Tonight" lights up the arena marquee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is jumping, and the arena is packed. In the cen the SuperFights ring/cage, and all the spotlights are on A martial arts demonstration is going on in the center, a crowd is cheering as three children use various martial a weapons in a demonstration. They finish and bow to the cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is sitting at his locker, his uniform on. It is a mi traditional martial arts and patriotic glitz - all in all however, the effect isn't bad. He's nervous, tapping his feet and taking deep breaths. Budokai and Darkcloud come over to him and clap him on th shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BUDOKAL
dialogues.text: Don't worry! The first one's a piece of cake!

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: You're being groomed for the big time, man. No way you'll lose!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You think so? You think I'm ready?

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: Sure! Who you going up against?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The Enforcer. Budokai and Darkcloud share a look, their smiles gone. Th quickly, they smile again.

dialogues.speaker: BUDOKAL
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about. The guy's a punk.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (wanting to believe) Great. Thanks. I feel much better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack getting SLAMMED in the face by The Enforcer, a huge, angry fighter. He gets HAMMERED again, and thrown to the canvas floor!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Take the fall, Jack! Absorb it! The Enforcer stands Jack up, and puts him into a hold tha very painful, but really isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We met before, didn't we? C'mon, Jack. I thought you were supposed to be the All American Hero. Show me something.

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: She is in the audience, and is very concerned about Jack. The Enforcer smiles and takes him down with an elaborate throw, then LANDS right on top of him. Jack's wind comes completely out of him, and he is just about out. He looks through the ropes, trying to find Angel, but ins spots Sally, who is sitting near the side of the ring. She motions for him to get up, and surprisingly, he start off the canvas. Jack stands completely up and turns to The Enforcer, who on the crowd in the center of the ring, his back to Jack, looking at him. Jack goes over and taps on The Enforcer's shoulder. The E turns, face curious, only to get BLASTED with a right cro He stumbles back and Jack starts a series of beautiful mo (ones that Angel taught him). The Enforcer is defenseless gets rocked over and over again. Finally, The Enforcer is out on his feet, and Jack sizes He launches and connects with a flying spinning hook kick knocking The Enforcer out! Jack's mother, relieved, gets up and walks out. She is no but she is glad that Jack is safe. Jack lands on his feet after the kick and the crowd goes Jack raises his hands in the air and quickly goes to the the ring where he saw Sally, looking for her in the crowd She is on her way to the ring. Jack sees that her seat is empty, and before he can look else, Angel grabs him and pulls him into a deep kiss. Sally sees this kiss and stops in her tracks, stunned. Sh and walks the other way.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You did it!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We did it! Jack is still looking for Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is training, and now all the other SuperFighters are gym training too. They are sparring, they are lifting wei some are working out on treadmills or exercise bikes. It flurry of activity. Jack is stretching to one side, taking it all in. He push rear end forward, holding that stretch.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I think I remember that position from somewhere... I just can't seem to put my finger on it... Angel puts her hand on his buttocks, and Jack jumps.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: C'mon, Angel. Cut it out!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You seem a little jumpy, you OK? Angel smiles and walks up, and Jack continues his stretch Budokai comes up to him, holding a kicking bag.

dialogues.speaker: BUDOKAL
dialogues.text: Hold this for me, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You bet. He steadies himself for the kick. Budokai does a stepping kick into the bag, propelling Jack into the wall behind h he hits a bunch of pads and other training apparatus. It down around Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nice kick, man. Budokai watches him for a moment, and looks like he's abo erupt in laughter. Then, he thinks better of it and goes where Jack is and helps him up.

dialogues.speaker: BUDOKAL
dialogues.text: You must have slipped, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Right, yeah, I slipped.

dialogues.speaker: JACK IN THE RING, FACING OFF AGAINST ANOTHE
dialogues.text: We just catch the tail end, as Jack prepares to knock him

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: No mercy! Jack takes him out with another flashy kick. This time, hasn't gotten hurt at all - he's the All American Hero, a Sally is in the audience again, watching and cheering for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, dressed in an expensive leather coat, exits the res with Angel on his arm. A line of FANS, mostly KIDS, are w outside with things for him to autograph. Jack loves the attention, and he stops and signs for them One especially cute KID waits at the end of the line. Jac at Angel and kneels down in front of him. The Kid holds t of paper out to Jack, then looks at him very seriously.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: You're my favorite in the whole world! (beat) Are you really a hero? Jack smiles and takes the paper, then turns and looks at smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I try my best, kid. I try my best. He signs the autograph and they walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An expensive limousine drives down the street. Suddenly, careens out of control through the intersection, sliding right in front of the limo. The LIMO DRIVER leans on the horn, but nobody gets out of The Limo Driver gets out and walks up to the car to see i is hurt, or if anyone needs help. From out of nowhere FLIES Budokai, KICKING the Limo Drive head, sending him down the ground. Out of the shadows of the street come two other SuperFigh Night Stalker and Darkcloud, and they jump into the front the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short, thin man, GERACIOTI, is sitting on the back seat beautiful women in various stages of undress are sitting him. On the floor is a satchel.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT STALKER
dialogues.text: Sorry to cause coitus interruptus, but I think you have something for us.  The man indicates the bag on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT STALKER
dialogues.text: I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: (reaching out for one of the women) And I'll take you! Night Stalker slaps Darkcloud on the arm and motions for get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: Maybe some other time, my sweet! They exit the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is in the ring, facing off against a bigger, faster, opponent, The Mercenary, this time. However, Jack wins ag using his impressive and very distinctive style to beat h In the audience sits Sally, cheering Jack on, anxious for catch a glimpse of her. The Grandfather is sitting with h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is in the bathroom, washing up. He is staring at him the mirror, examining his face and his body. He is wearin bikini briefs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Did you think that fight tonight went awful fast? I mean, I barely hit him and he went down.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You were great, Jack! They loved you!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, but was I that great? Am I that good?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Don't ask me, I'm not exactly impartial...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, but do you think they're taking it easy on me because I'm new? I don't want anything given to me... Jack grabs a robe and walks out of the bathroom, comes ar corner towards the bedroom, and there stands Angel, dress in a dress shirt and panties. She is in a fighting stance hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to give it up to me!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (after a beat) C'mon, Angel. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You want a fight, you got one.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (smiling) I've never fought anyone in lace panties before.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Enjoy it while you can.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Angel... She attacks, and they trade playful techniques, and then SWEEPS her to the bed, landing next to her in an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Oh, Jack Cody, you sweep me off my feet. She pulls him into a kiss, laughing. Jack returns the kis moment, then pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jack. Just one time? It doesn't have to mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes, it does. Besides, you're my trainer, and my friend.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: What are friends for? Jack doesn't say anything, so she gets up.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're missing. She leaves, but not before giving Jack a good look at her

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm getting a sneak preview...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geracioti is sitting with his wise guys in the apartment, and bitching about the way things are, and the way things be. Geracioti is talking to his two bodyguards, MUSCLE 1 MUSCLE 2. A large metal ceiling fan is spinning fast above their he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys think they got us, think we're gonna just roll over - they got another think coming. The Gang Leader stands up and walks, posturing.

dialogues.speaker: GERACIOTI
dialogues.text: They gonna get the message when they open that briefcase, you know what I'm saying? We control too much to just give it away. Suddenly, the lights go OFF, plunging the apartment into darkness. A second later, the emergency lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: GERACIOTI
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: MUSCLE 1
dialogues.text: I'm there, checkinГўв‚¬в„ў... The door to the room SMASHES open! The Beast BLASTS throu room, hitting everything in his way. He knocks out both o Muscles, then GRABS Geracioti by the throat and lifts him ground. They are right under the fast moving ceiling fan. Geracioti is screaming, and sounds of running and shoutin heard out in the halls. Robert walks through the shattered door, flanked by Darkc Night Stalker.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: We opened the case. (beat) Wake one of them up! I want a witness when he dies. Darkcloud JERKS one of the Muscles up off the ground, and him in the face to bring him around. Robert walks over to Leader and smiles. He looks up at th fan.

dialogues.speaker: GERACIOTI
dialogues.text: C'mon, man! DON'T!! Robert ignores him and turns to the Muscle.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: You see this? This is what happens. DO YOU

dialogues.speaker: SEE
dialogues.text: The Muscle nods his head, scared that he's next. Robert, after a BEAT, turns back to the Beast and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one steals from me. No one. Robert motions to the Beast and he raises Geracioti up. Geracioti's head hits the fan, and blood SPRAYS all over

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: This must be what they mean when they say the shit hits the fan. Robert watches for a moment, then turns to the Muscle. He right up to him, face to sweating face.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Spread the word. Fear me. He exits without another word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is running and training outside, throwing punches wh works on his endurance. It is foggy out, and as Jack turn of the paths, he sees a hulking Figure. He stops for a moment, spooked, and looks for the Figure, gone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Who's there? He continues running, but suddenly, he is attacked by a M Man. They fight, and the Masked Man is a much better figh Jack. Jack is trying to block him, but he cannot.

dialogues.speaker: MASKED MAN
dialogues.text: You're not winning the fights, they're losing them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Bullshit! I'm a great fighter. The Masked Man SLAMS Jack HARD, sending him to the ground

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: MASKED MAN
dialogues.text: Robert's not just a promoter, and you're not just a fighter. It goes way beyond that. Illegal death matches, fixing fights, gambling, drugs, organized crime, murder - he's into it all. You've got to get out while you can.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I haven't seen any of that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. But you will. You're a product, and once you are the fighter he wants you to be, you'll become a killer too. Like the rest...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I won those fights...

dialogues.speaker: MASKED MAN
dialogues.text: We both know you didn't. Pull out while you still can. And, Jack, don't take the pills. They aren't vitamins...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Wait! How do I do that? The Masked Man is walking away, but he pauses right befor exits.

dialogues.speaker: MASKED MAN
dialogues.text: Just say no. He is gone, leaving Jack standing in the park all alone. the life of a SuperFighter doesn't seem quite so glamorou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is walking along the riverfront, his hands in his po is absently watching the traffic on the river, and the pe walking around him. Jack walks a little bit more, then notices a man off to o in a little park, going through a martial arts routine. I style Tai Zhi Quan, and the man is obviously an expert. J a little closer for a better look, and realizes that the Sally's Grandfather. Jack smiles and watches the man move. Very athletic, very graceful, with an underlying strength. The man finishes up a particularly intricate set, then go drinks some water out of a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: (his back to Jack) You haven't come to see my granddaughter again.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I didn't feel particularly welcome.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You give up on everything so easily? Jack thinks about that one for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, but I...  Jack thinks Grandfather Grandfather

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: She is a rare jewel, a wonderful girl... woman.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes, she is.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Yet you don't come to see her?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I have no answer for that.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: I see you in the TV ads. You're a famous fighter now.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Famous.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You are troubled by something?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You could say that.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: I began training my daughter in the martial arts. Will you do me a favor?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Come to her training tomorrow morning, 6:30 am, sharp! It will be a happy surprise for her. for a moment, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: For us both. Can you teach me to move like you? scribbles an address on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: I'm not a miracle worker. <Smile> Here's the address. It's not much, but it serves our purpose.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow morning. starts in on another form.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is that Tai Zhi? No answer from Grandfather. Jack smiles and walks on, fe better than he's felt in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is deserted when Grandfather and Sally drive up in his up pick up truck. They get out and Grandfather looks arou Jack. There is a homeless person sleeping under a paper b some trash barrels, but no Jack. Grandfather shakes his head, angry at Jack, and at himsel

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Grandfather?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Life is filled with disappointments, Granddaughter. Let's go inside. As they head for the door to the warehouse, the figure un paper box stirs, and then stands up. It's Jack!

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Jack! Jack turns towards her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where have you guys been? Grandfather is sincerely pleased that Jack is there, but doing his best to hide it. Jack and Sally embrace, but that is quickly broken up by Grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: We are here to train, not kissie kissie. Jack and Sally come apart, reluctantly, and line up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Time's a wasting, Grandfather! They go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Sally are lined up in the middle of the warehous has some old Chinese training devices in it, as well as miscellaneous boxes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The martial arts are about controlling your body, your mind... and your emotions. Jack and Sally look at each other and smile.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Horse stance! They both get into a horse stance, and what follows is a

dialogues.speaker: OF TRAINING SEQUENCES
dialogues.text: Grandfather repositions Jack's hands. Sally SLAMMING Jack chest with a palm heel. Grandfather working on footwork a movement with Jack. Jack kicking, and Grandfather coming showing him a slightly different way. Jack and Sally stretching together. They are sweaty tired, but there is a spark there. The workout is over, and Jack is riding a high that he's felt before. He yanks his jacket off the floor, and his k out, and so does one of the pills.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: (picking up the pill) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: They said they were vitamins.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Don't take any more until I check it out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sure. Thanks for having me.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You will come back tomorrow? Sally smiles and looks at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Bright and early. (to Sally) You want to have dinner tonight? Sally smiles and is about to say yes. Before she can say however,

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Jack! Both Jack and Sally, surprised, turn towards the Grandfat is steeling himself for another scolding.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: You have her home by 11:00 pm, no later! You hear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet, Grandfather. Grandfather smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: See you tonight! He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Sally are eating at a very nice restaurant. We c them through the front plate glass window. A couple of pe up for autographs, but then they are alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is lifting weights, around the other SuperFighters. certain time, all of them are provided with pills and cup water to drink them with. Jack takes his, and makes like drinking them. After he drinks, Darkcloud winks at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: DARKCLOUD
dialogues.text: Breakfast of champions, eh, Jack? Jack smiles and then coughs into his fist. The pills he p mouth are shot into his hand, and he stuffs them into the of his workout shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Sally are training together, doing a little spar After they have warmed up a little, Grandfather puts them the paces. He runs Jack through an agility drill, then ho pads for him to hit.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: I had the pill checked out, Jack. Steroids, growth hormone and some other chemical.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Don't remember. The pharmacist said something about mind control.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I stopped taking the pills, but they'll know something's going on if I'm not getting any stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Qi training. He places an aluminum can in front of Jack.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Hit this. Jack goes to punch the can, but Grandfather moves it so t is punching at air.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: With your qi. Qi is inner energy. Your life force. Everyone has qi, you just have to learn how to use it. Watch! Grandfather puts his hand out and stops it about 6 inches can. He closes his eyes and concentrates, an amber glow s his hand (SFX), and then the can MOVES ABOUT SIX INCHES! All by itself!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What the hell? (beat) Do that again!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: (fire in his eyes) It's not a magic trick! You do it! Jack puts the can up on the table and put his hand out, m Grandfather, looking stupid. He concentrates but the can to move. Jack smiles. He thinks it's a trick.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's qi? Qi. (mispronounces the word) Sounds like you are sneezing.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Qi.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Bless you. Grandfather walks over to Jack and puts his hand on his s

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: It's Chinese for inner energy, Jack. QI! He then flexes his palm on Jack's shoulder, and Jack goe across the room, SLAMMING against the wall and sliding do Jack nods, then pronounces the word correctly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Q-Q-Q-Q-Q-Qi.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: Qi can be used for protection, and for attack. It requires much practice, and meditation. Breathing and qi are connected. Each breath brings in power and strength...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is sitting and meditating with his eyes closed. Sitt to him is Grandfather, who has his eyes OPEN! Sally is be both, her eyes closed. Jack is having real trouble concentrating. He is shifting position, rolling his head on his shoulders, trying to ge comfortable. He opens his eyes and looks around, and sees Grandfather has his eyes open. He looks at Sally, then back to Grandfather. He then puts out in front of Grandfather, to see if he can see the han No reaction. He does a few more things, then decides he is going to at Grandfather. He prepares a backfist, then lets it fly tow Grandfather's head. Before it can land, however, Grandfather blocks it with o and SLAPS the back of Jack's head with the other.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDFATHER
dialogues.text: This meditation is more advanced. It trains you to distinguish the false from the true. Now, clear your mind and continue. Grandfather and Jack continue to meditate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are saying good-bye outside the house.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Your grandfather's a great guy.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Didn't start out that way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just looking out for you.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I got news for you, he's still looking out for me. She pulls him into a kiss, and it's a major league, passi one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is training with Angel. He's working on the heavy ba she's watching him, charting his progress.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You're not getting much stronger, Jack. I don't get it. We normally see 25% increase by this time, and you're way behind schedule. What gives?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Got me, Coach. Just then, Robert walks in, briefcase in hand, and motion Darkcloud and Night Stalker to join him. They break off f training and follow him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I gotta take a leak... I mean, I have to use the facilities, Ma'am. May I?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I'll be right here. Jack grabs and towels and heads down the hallway to the b and walks right by the room where Robert, Darkcloud and N Stalker went. Jack pauses outside the door for a moment, Robert put the briefcase down on the desk and open it. Ja glimpse of money in the suitcase, lots of money, before t is closed. Jack continues on to the restroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert and Angel are getting dressed, after having made l his office. Robert treats Angel like his property, and An starting not to like it.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: So, what's up with Jack? He checking out, strength and speed and all that?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (after a slight hesitation) He's right on schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I can trust him? I look ata lot of fighters, Angel, and I can't afford to get burnt. Do you think it's time we took him out with us?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Not yet. Hell, he still thinks he's winning his fights, fair and square.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
